intro: Acisanthera tetraptera, commonly known as the four-winged acacia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, featuring a woody stem and compound leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by distinctive four-winged fruits. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets, and the plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Acisanthera tetraptera is often found in savannas and rocky areas, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various insects.
